question_text: An elderly woman with diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and atrial fibrillation had an episode of syncope followed by convulsions. The episode was witnessed by her family, who reported that she was confused for a short period afterward. Upon presentation to the emergency department, her blood pressure was 90/70, and she was fatigued but conscious and oriented. Which of the following will help you with the diagnosis?

options.A: pregnant lady post tumor resection on oral contraceptive pills (OCP) and known to have seizures. Which of the following antiepileptic drugs (AED) would be least likely to interact with her oral contraceptive pills?

question_text: In a scenario of uncontrolled epilepsy on 2 AEDs, what is the next step?

question_text: Lennox-Gastaut syndrome is characterized by which of the following triad?

options.A: Absence seizures, 3 Hz spike-and-wave EEG, normal intelligence
options.B: Infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia on EEG, developmental regression
options.C: Multiple seizure types, slow spike-and-wave EEG pattern, cognitive impairment
options.D: Focal seizures, temporal lobe EEG abnormalities, normal development

question_text: In a pregnant patient with seizures, which statement is true?

options.A: Lamotrigine clearance increases in the 1st and 2nd trimester
options.B: Levetiracetam is the safest medication during pregnancy
options.D: All antiepileptic drugs are safe during pregnancy

question_text: The patient, an alcoholic with a known case of epilepsy on antiepileptic medication (ASM), came with an active seizure. After being loaded with IV VPA, he was agitated and then had a decreased level of consciousness. What should be done next?

options.A: 53-year-old male who presented with a first-time generalized tonic-clonic seizure, normal physical examination, and normal EEG, with no family history of epilepsy, what is his risk of seizure recurrence?

young lady diagnosed with mesial temporal lobe epilepsy (MTLE) is on lamotrigine and carbamazepine. Her last generalized tonic-clonic seizure was a couple of months ago, but she presents to the clinic with episodes of partial unaware seizures occurring four times a month. What is the best next step?
